Ed Sheeran Reveals 'Love Yourself' Was Originally Written For His New Album 'Divide'  It's no secret that Ed Sheeran had a hand in writing Justin Bieber's megahit "Love Yourself," but the British singer-songwriter recently revealed that the Biebs actually wasn't the original artist in mind when he penned it. Without Bieber, though, the chart-topping tune would still be nonexistent -- or may have never even come to fruition.  â€œThat was a song I had written for Divide. It just wouldnâ€™t have made it," Sheeran explained in an interview with Carson Daly on 97.1 AMP Radio Monday morning (Jan. 9). "And then Justin took it and did his thing on it, and released it as a single and made it what it is. So going from a song that would have never been released to [being] the biggest song of last year -- it just became Billboard's #1 of 2016 of the whole year, and [was] nominated for Song of the Year at the GRAMMYs -- it just shows you that you shouldnâ€™t always write stuff off.â€  Sheeran didn't elaborate on what kind of touch Bieber had on the song, but he made sure to give the Purpose singer some credit. "[Justin] did have input on it, I wouldnâ€™t say it was just all me."  Those who pay close attention to Bieber's Twitter may have noticed that Sheeran also had a role in another one of the Bieb's 2016 hits: the Major Lazer/MÃ˜ collaboration "Cold Water." But before Sheeran actually heard the track, he didn't realize he had written yet another smash for Bieber.  â€œâ€˜Cold Waterâ€™ was a weird one because I didnâ€™t even know that song existed,â€ he explained. â€œIt was a song I mustâ€™ve half-written somewhere at a time where I was writing a lot of songs and I did it at Benny Blancoâ€™s house and then I got an email from Diplo just being like, â€˜Yo! That â€˜Cold Waterâ€™ song is dope! Can I have it?â€™ And I was like, â€˜I have no idea what youâ€™re talking about,â€™ so I just didnâ€™t reply. And then he emailed and was like, â€œYo, Justin [Bieber] wants to hop on the â€˜Cold Waterâ€™ song. Is that cool?â€™ And Iâ€™m just like, â€˜What are you talking about?â€™... And then the song came out and it was number one and I was like â€˜Oh, that song!â€™ I remember doing it, but it was really, really slow. I remember hearing it and being like â€˜That kind of sounds like me. Oh wait, it was me.'"  While fans may never get to hear Sheeran's versions of "Cold Water" or "Love Yourself" -- though he did give one live performance of the latter in December -- they did get a sneak peak last week of what's to come with Divide. Sheeran released "Castle on the Hill," an homage to his hometown of Suffolk, England, and the sexually charged "Shape of You," which both shot to the top of iTunes on Friday (Jan. 6), and set a Spotify record in their first 24 hours of release.  Sheeran revealed on Jan. 12 that Divide will be dropping March 3, and has previously said that he will be sharing a few more new tunes from the LP prior to its release. Listen to his full AMP Radio interview below.

Kim Kardashian will not leave Kanye West despite all the rumors.  Kim Kardashian and Kanye West have seen their names mentioned in hundreds of rumors over the years and they arenâ€™t slowing down. Amid the backlash that West is receiving for making controversial comments, reports are coming out that their marriage could be coming to an end soon. Most of those rumors also insinuate that Kardashian is planning to end the marriage.  According to a recent report from Grazia, Kardashian is planning to leave West and even has an â€œescape planâ€ to leave him.  â€œThings between her and Kanye are at a breaking point. The marriage has been under increasing pressure lately and she fears all the controversy Kanye is causing is reflecting negatively on her and her family. Thereâ€™s concern this marriage is on borrowed time. Kim may come across as his long-suffering wife, but she has been ready to leave on a number of occasions and has had multiple exit strategies in place over the years.â€  Gossip Cop has since debunked the rumor that Kardashian has â€œexit strategiesâ€ and an â€œescape planâ€ in place to get away from West. She has shown some frustration with his controversial comments, but the two seems to be doing just fine despite all of the rumors.  â€œNone of this adds up to a divorce. In fact, Kardashianâ€™s rep has already gone on record to tell Gossip Cop itâ€™s â€˜falseâ€™ sheâ€™s intending end the marriage. That will be evident in a few days, when the couple marks their fourth wedding anniversary on May 24.â€  Kardashian has come out and publicly joked that West is the cause of her first gray hair.  â€œ[Kanye] gave me my first gray hair this week, and I am blaming that on him.â€  That is nothing to write home about as far as divorce rumors are concerned. She also went on to state that West is doing well and is out in Wyoming working on new music.  â€œHeâ€™s doing really good. Heâ€™s in Wyoming recording, he has a couple of albums coming out, so heâ€™s just focused on that.â€  West even took to Twitter to post a picture of Kim with fire emojiâ€™s as the only description. Obviously, he still finds his wife incredibly beautiful.  Rumors are going to continue swirling. Nothing is going to change on the fake report front when it comes to Kardashian and West, but this report can be ignored now that Gossip Cop has debunked it.

LOS ANGELESâ€”(Spoiler alert: This column has spoilers about the movie, â€œInterstellar.â€) Why was Matt Damonâ€™s casting in â€œInterstellarâ€ kept under wraps until recently? This question and more were answered by spouses Christopher Nolan and Emma Thomas, director and producer, respectively, of the sci-fi/adventure/drama.  â€œInterstellar,â€ written by Chris and his brother Jonah, follows a team of explorers as they travel beyond the galaxy to find another home for humankind since Earth is nearing its end.  While â€œInterstellarâ€ features some stunning visual images of the voyage, the film succeeds more when it delves into relationships through a family, that of Cooper (Matthew McConaughey), an experienced pilot, and his two children, Murph (Mackenzie Foy) and Tom (Timothee Chalamet).  ADVERTISEMENT  Jessica Chastain and Ellen Burstyn portray Murph at various ages while Casey Affleck plays the older Tom. Anne Hathaway, Wes Bentley, Michael Caine, John Lithgow and Topher Grace round out the cast.  Excerpts from our interview:  Why did you keep Matt Damonâ€™s casting a secret?  Chris Nolan (C): I imagined Doctor Mann a bit like from Joseph Conradâ€™s â€œHeart of Darkness.â€ You have Kurtz, this character that you hear about. Everybody says, â€œOh, heâ€™s great. Maybe youâ€™ll get to meet him.â€ I really love the idea for an audience to go, when they see him, â€œOh, itâ€™s Matt Damon. Itâ€™s going to be okay.â€  Matt very graciously agreed to do it. He didnâ€™t have to shoot for long. So we didnâ€™t want to market the film using him because heâ€™s not in it very much. We didnâ€™t want to mislead people. But Matt is a very important part of the movie. Itâ€™s fun to watch with an audience who doesnâ€™t know because they havenâ€™t heard about it.  Matt has the most amazing ability to project integrity and warmth. So he turns up in the film and heâ€™s got a plan and itâ€™s all going to be okay. For me, to realize that heâ€™s a frail human being and subject to cowardice and all the terrible weaknesses that we all haveâ€¦ he loved that challenge. I loved what he did with it.  Emma Thomas (E): If people get to watch the film twice, itâ€™s so great watching Matt when you know whatâ€™s really going on.  C: When people see Mattâ€™s face, they are like, oh, okay. Itâ€™s the lift that the movie needs at that point. Structurally, you have a lot of talk in the 20 minutes before. Thereâ€™s a lot of negativity, a lot bad things happening. The film is very much going to a dark place at that point. So getting that lift in that way with a great actor and movie star coming on screen, is a good thing.  ADVERTISEMENT  How has the dynamics between the two of you evolved over the years?  E: (Laughs.) We love working togetherâ€” obviously, with Jonah as wellâ€”in a large part because, when you are working with somebody whom you are tied to beyond by blood or marriage, thereâ€™s a lack of agenda. Or as Chris once said, I (Emma) have an agenda. He knows what it is. (Laughs.)  But thereâ€™s a level of trust that is fantastic, particularly when you are making a big movie like this one. I am often asked as a producer and when Chris is the director, â€œWhen do you tell Chris, no, he canâ€™t have that?â€ The truth is, I am very lucky because Chris is also a producer. He takes every aspect of the filmmaking process very seriously.  He is very helpful in terms of trying to figure out how we make the film for the correct budget, and so on. To me, itâ€™s never absolutely saying no. I tell Chris [how I feel about] certain things. We have discussions. But ultimately, itâ€™s Chrisâ€™ vision. He always has a very strong idea of what a film is going to be. Heâ€™s the director and itâ€™s very much his film.  I see my job as being very much a facilitator for that, filtering out the things that he doesnâ€™t have to worry about so he can concentrate on getting the film made.  C: Itâ€™s fantastic working with people you have worked with a long time and have a high degree of trust in. Emma is always very objective, which is greatâ€¦ I consider Emma a very good gauge (from a moviegoer perspective) because sheâ€™s not particularly interested in science-fiction or science. (Laughs.)  I show her the film and ask, â€œAre you following the emotional threads?â€ Whatâ€™s wonderful about working with someone like Emma is that I get an honest opinion, good or bad, instantly. There are no politics to it.  This filmâ€™s working title or code name was â€œFloraâ€™s Letter,â€ a cinematic letter to your daughter. How is your relationship with your kids reflected in the story?  C: The relationship between a father and his children was clearly something I related to very strongly in the script. Murph was originally written as a boy in my brotherâ€™s draft. I changed the character to a girlâ€”just instinctively. It may well be because Flora, my eldest, is a girl.  You do have different relationships with sons and daughters. It really paid off with Matthew because what he was very determined about was that his characterâ€™s love for his children should be equal for both. The character having a girl and a boy took the burden off the idea of favoritism. Itâ€™s not that he loves Murph more than he loves Tom. Thereâ€™s just a different relationship. And Murph is more interested in science and the things that have driven her fatherâ€™s life.  E: Girls are much more complicated, I feel. And boys are ratherâ€¦  C: Simple.  E: I wouldnâ€™t say simple.  C: Thatâ€™s what you were thinking, though.  E: Itâ€™s complicated. Itâ€™s one of my favorite things about the film. I almost donâ€™t think of it as a big, spectacular space movie. I really love the relationships. They feel very real to me as the mother of a girl and boys.  When I watch Mackenzieâ€™s performance, she feels incredibly real to me. I [see] my own daughter in her. Going back to the code name question, I will just say that we have always had code names for our filmsâ€”our kidsâ€™ names. It was just Floraâ€™s turn (laughs).  What are the kidsâ€™ ages?  E: Now thatâ€™s a difficult question (laughs). They are 12, 11, 9 and 7. Flora is the oldest.  Emma, you were quoted as saying that Chris could not have done this film 12 years ago when you didnâ€™t have kids. Can you both talk about that?  E: I am not saying that Chris couldnâ€™t have made this film 12 years ago. But thereâ€™s such a heart, such a reality to the relationships in the movie. The reason we pick a movie to makeâ€”because itâ€™s a long processâ€”is that you have to feel an affinity for the story. You have to want to put that story up on the screen.  The place that Chris and I are in now is very different from where we were 12 years ago. This is a story that we are interested in telling. Itâ€™s also a movie that is fun to watch with our kids. We watch different movies now than we did 12 years ago because the kids came along.  C: The simple answer is, I donâ€™t know if I couldnâ€™t [have done this movie 12 years ago], but I wouldnâ€™t have and I didnâ€™t. Becoming a father was a very big change in my life, something that affected my outlook and the kind of stories that I am interested in telling and in ways that I would have never been able to predict and not in simple ways.  We did a press conference yesterday and Matthew was asked about being a father. He said he could have played the part even before he had kids. What I didnâ€™t say to him because I didnâ€™t want to embarrass himâ€”but I am going to embarrass him nowâ€”is that I would have found it very difficult to cast someone who wasnâ€™t a father. Matthew was absolutely the right person to play the role. Heâ€™s a terrific father.  Why did you choose a Dylan Thomas poem to use in the film?  C: Those lines at the endâ€”â€œDo not go gentle into that good nightâ€¦ Rage, rage against the dying of the lightâ€â€”I have [not] heard a better way of expressing the sentiment of death, dying, the end of the world, any of those things. Thereâ€™s such a raw emotion in those words; they speak to me so strongly. I didnâ€™t want to write my own version of that. Another example, which I didnâ€™t use, would be of TS Elliot saying, â€œThis is the way the world ends/Not with a bang but a whimper.â€  (E-mail the columnist at rvnepales_5585@yahoo.com. Follow him at www.twitter.com/nepalesruben.)

new survey by american dental association indicates that less than 1 percent of dentists nationwide have tested positive for covid-19. experts say that s because of safety policies and disinfectant practices dental offices have had for decades. experts add that dental health is important not only for your teeth but also because dental infections can lead to other ailments including heart disease. all data and statistics are based on publicly available data at time of publicati.

After several weeks of fun, heartfelt performances, Sasha Pieterse's Dancing With the Stars journey has come to an end, and the actress admits that she's sad to say goodbye.  Pieterse and her pro partner, Gleb Savchenko, were eliminated at the end of DWTS's Disney Night on Monday, and the pair spoke with ET's Keltie Knight after the show.  "I'm not mad, I'm just really bummed. I really wanted to be here," the Pretty Little Liars star shared. "It sucks, but I made some amazing friends, I had such a good time, and I feel like I'm just grateful."  One thing she's particularly grateful for is Savchenko, whom she's become fast friends with over the course of the season. They're so tight, in fact, that Pieterse's pro partner is going to give a few lessons to her fiance, Hudson Sheaffer.  "[Gleb] can't get away from me that easy, he's going to teach my fiancÃ© how to dance," she said, smiling.  WATCH: Sasha Pieterse Channels 'The Little Mermaid' on 'DWTS's Disney Night, Reveals She's Lost 37 Pounds  Going into Monday night, Pieterse and Savchenko were tied with five other couples for fourth place, having earned a score of 24 out of 30 for their foxtrot during the show's Most Memorable Year night last week.  So, while they weren't near the top of the leader board, they had been in past weeks and they weren't really on anyone's list of stars who were expected to go home tonight. (The same goes for Frankie Muniz and Witney Carson, who were one of the other couples to earn a 24 last week and also found themselves in jeopardy during Monday's elimination.)  PHOTOS: The Complete List: 'Dancing with the Stars' Winners  Savchenko admits that the elimination was just as much a shock to him as anyone. "I never thought it would happen. I thought we have another couple of weeks at least," he said. "But it's a dance competition, someone's gotta go and unfortunately it's us."  "I'm so proud of my partner," he added. "She came so far, she did such a good job tonight. You've shown such a huge improvement and as a teacher, I'm really, really proud of you."  Throughout the season, Pieterse, 21, got candid with Savchecko and her fans about her battle with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, a hormone imbalance that led to her gaining nearly 70 pounds in around two years. On Monday, she revealed that, since joining the show, she'd managed to lose 37 pounds and previously said that the show has helped her to start "feeling like me again."  WATCH: 'DWTS': Jordan Fisher & Lindsay Arnold Earn Perfect 10s for 'Moana' Foxtrot on Disney Night  So for Pieterse, this season has meant more to her than just a chance to improve her dance skills -- it's given her the opportunity to change her life.  "It really has been an incredible experience and you can't really describe it unless you're doing it. It's been amazing for my soul, for me just getting back to who I am, [and] obviously for my body and my health," she shared. "I'm just really glad that I was able to have the platform to talk about my situation and I had so much fun."  Check out the video below to hear more from Pieterse about how DWTS has contributed to her weight-loss journey.  Related Gallery

Steven Bochco, a producer whose boundary-pushing series such as â€œHill Street Bluesâ€ and â€œNYPD Blueâ€ helped define the modern TV drama, has died. He was 74.  Bochco had been battling a rare form of leukemia for several years. He had a transplant in late 2014 that was credited with prolonging his life. A family spokesman told the Associated Press that he died in his sleep on Sunday after a battle with cancer, but did not release details of a memorial service.  Working with different collaborators, Bochco co-created some of TVâ€™s most popular series for more than 20 years while helping to create the template for modern hourlongs featuring large ensemble casts, serialized storylines and edgy content.  The recipient of numerous industry awards, including the Humanitas Prize and Peabody honors, Bochco was nominated for an Emmy 30 times in his capacities as producer and writer, winning 10.  On â€œNYPD Blue,â€ he consciously set out to expand the parameters of what was acceptable on broadcast television, and he recalled sitting with then-ABC Entertainment chief Robert Iger â€” who went on to become CEO of the Walt Disney Co. â€” drawing naked figures, determining exactly how much of the body could be shown.  Related 'NYPD Blue' Follow-Up Series Lands Pilot Production Commitment at ABC 'NYPD Blue' at 25: Dennis Franz, Amy Brenneman, Gordon Clapp Reflect on Legacy  Bochco launched such series as â€œHill Street Bluesâ€ â€” a ground-breaking, Emmy-winning cop show â€” and â€œL.A. Lawâ€ for NBC before entering into a landmark 10-series deal with ABC in the late 1980s. The relationship produced some clear hits (â€œNYPD Blue,â€ â€œDoogie Howser, M.D.â€) and notable failures, including the musical police drama â€œCop Rockâ€ and the serialized courtroom drama â€œMurder One,â€ which followed a single murder trial over an entire season. As virtual proof the latter was ahead of its time, Bochco essentially revived it in 2014, under the title â€œMurder in the First,â€ for TNT, where it ran for three years.  Asked how he could risk gambling on a musical like â€œCop Rockâ€ given the richness of his ABC pact, Bochco once joked, â€œWith my deal, how could I not?â€  Bochco wasnâ€™t above engaging in public spats and power struggles, from complaining about his treatment by network executives to tussling with recalcitrant stars. In one of the highest-profile tiffs, his rift with David Caruso during the first season of â€œNYPD Blueâ€ led to the actorâ€™s exit, a considerable gamble for a series in its first season. Bochco replaced him with former â€œL.A. Lawâ€ co-star Jimmy Smits, and the program went on to run for 11 years.  Although Bochco often consciously pressed against boundaries and seemed to delight in testing censors, he recalled that the breakthrough storytelling style of â€œHill Streetâ€ was born more out of necessity than design.  â€œWe had so many characters that we realized we couldnâ€™t service 10 or 11 characters within the confines of a single episode, so the only way that we could really do justice to the size of the world was by creating storylines that spilled over the margins,â€ he told the New York Times.  The producer also had a way of celebrating even his failures. When â€œCop Rockâ€ came to an end after a mere 11 episodes, what turned out to be the final episode incorporated a musical sequence where a fat lady literally sang, signaling its cancellation.  Bochco also appeared to relish nettling his critics, saying that the pressure campaign waged against â€œNYPD Blueâ€ â€“ which helped prompt dozens of stations not to air the show when it premiered â€“ ultimately helped promote the series and turned it into a hit.  Steven Ronald Bochco was born in New York, the son of a violin virtuoso (which inspired his production companyâ€™s onscreen logo). He attended NYU and subsequently Carnegie Institute of Technology, receiving a degree in theater.  He started his writing career in the 1960s. Credits included â€œColumbo,â€ with an episode directed by Steven Spielberg, who also came up through the ranks at Universal Television.  Bochco wrote such features as â€œThe Movie Makerâ€ and â€œSilent Runningâ€ before he began to steadfastly focus on television and create his own shows, including â€œDelvecchio,â€ a drama starring Judd Hirsch. Later came â€œBay City Blues,â€ about a baseball team, which didnâ€™t last.  With â€œHill Street Blues,â€ Bochco and co-creator Michael Kozoll broke the dramatic mold, featuring a huge ensemble cast and gritty narrative while juggling various subplots. NBC was in the ratings cellar at the time, but its patience with prestige programs like â€œHill Streetâ€ and â€œCheersâ€ was rewarded after â€œThe Cosby Showâ€ premiered in 1984, turning its Thursday lineup into a ratings juggernaut.  Beyond his own career, Bochco helped shepherd along those of several other prominent writers, hiring David Milch on â€œHill Streetâ€ and enlisting David E. Kelley â€” then a Boston lawyer â€” to work on â€œL.A. Law.â€  When the Producers Guild of America honored Bochco with its David Susskind lifetime achievement award in 1999, his track record of quality programs was cited as â€œthe standard all television producers strive for.â€  For all of his success with police dramas and legal shows, Bochco produced a wide variety of series, from the animated satire â€œCapitol Crittersâ€ to â€œPublic Morals,â€ an edgy comedy on which he collaborated with Jay Tarses that also ran into standards-and-practices problems.  Although major successes eluded him in his later years, Bochco remained active and in demand, taking over as showrunner of â€œCommander in Chiefâ€ â€” an ABC drama that featured Geena Davis as the first female U.S. president â€” and co-creating â€œOver There,â€ an FX series that focused on soldiers in Iraq and their families back home. The latter, introduced while the war was ongoing in 2005, engendered controversy because of the timing and subject matter.  Bochco also produced the legal drama â€œRaising the Barâ€ for TNT that ran two seasons in 2008 and 2009.  The producer also tried his hand at novels, writing â€œDeath by Hollywood,â€ a darkly comic satire with a struggling screenwriter as its protagonist. His struggle with leukemia prompted him to write his autobiography, â€œTruth is a Total Defense: My Fifty Years in Television,â€ which he self-published in 2016.  Bochco was loyal to his friends â€” certain actors appeared in his shows time and again â€” but could also nurse a grudge. He also became disenchanted with what he saw as creative interference from the networks, hewing more toward cable.  Bochcoâ€™s association with the business extended to his family. His second wife, Barbara Bosson, co-starred in â€œHill Street Blues,â€ and his sister, Joanna Frank, had a recurring role on â€œL.A. Lawâ€ as the wife of firm partner Douglas Brackman, played by her real-life husband (and thus Bochcoâ€™s brother-in-law), Alan Rachins. The producer later married Dayna Kalins, a TV executive. His son, Jesse, became a prominent director, working on many of his fatherâ€™s shows.  Bochco was thrice married, the first time to Gabrielle Levin, the second to Bosson.  He is survived by his third wife Dayna Kalins, whom he married in 2000, as well children Melissa Bochco, Jesse Bochco and Sean Flanagan, and two grandchildren.

CLOSE TV host Maria Menounos had to pick just the right time to tell her family that she had a brain tumor. Time  Maria Menounos at the 2015 Annual White House Correspondents' Association Dinner. (Photo: Michael Loccisano, Getty Images)  NEW YORK (AP) â€” Maria Menounos says she has been diagnosed with a benign brain tumor and has announced her resignation from E! News.  Menounos tells People magazine that she underwent surgery last month to remove a golf-ball-sized tumor discovered in February. Menounos says 99.9 percent of the tumor was removed during the seven-hour procedure on June 8. She says there's a small chance that it could come back.  E! says Monday that Menounos is leaving the network after three years. The cable network says it believes Menounos will tackle her health struggles "with the same fierce dedication she is known for."  Menounos, who is also caring for her mother battling stage-four brain cancer, wrote a lengthy Instagram post on Monday thanking her supporters, her doctors and her fiancÃ© Keven Undergaro.  "First I wanna say thank you all for the well wishes, prayers and support. It's been a crazy time here in our home. I want you all to know that I'm ok! Seriously I'm recovering well and should be as good as new very very soon! Luckily I don't need any further treatments but I can't say the same about my mom. So please keep her in your prayers," she captioned the photo of her and her mom.  As for how she's feeling, the 39-year-old says her face is still numb from the surgery but should be back to normal soon.  Copyright 2017 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. Scott Wilson, a star of The Walking Dead, In Cold Blood and many others, died at his home in Los Angeles on Saturday due to complications from leukemia. He was 76.  Wilsonâ€™s rep Dominic Mancini confirmed the news to PEOPLE Saturday evening. â€œScott was one of the most genuine, inspirational, and truly beloved people,â€ Mancini said. â€œHis amazing legacy will live on through his timeless performances. He will be missed deeply by his wife, family, and friends.â€  Get push notifications with news, features and more.  â€œScott will always be remembered as a great actor and we all feel fortunate to have known him as an even better person,â€ AMC said in a statement. â€œThe character he embodied on The Walking Dead, Hershel, lived at the emotional core of the show. Like Scott in our lives, Hershel was a character whose actions continue to inform our charactersâ€™ choices to this day. Our hearts go out to his wife, family, friends and to the millions of fans who loved him. Scott will be missed.â€  The news of Wilsonâ€™s death came within hours of the New York Comic-Con announcement that he would be reprising his role as Hershel Greene during the first half of The Walking Deadâ€˜s ninth season, which kicks off this Sunday. It will be one of his final onscreen performances.  Wilson is survived by his wife, Heavenly, whom he married in 1977. Born in Georgia in 1942, Wilson made his onscreen debut in 1967â€™s In the Heat of the Night and followed it up later that year with the role of real-life murderer Dick Hickock in an adaptation of Truman Capoteâ€™s In Cold Blood. He played George Wilson opposite Robert Redford in 1974â€™s The Great Gatsby and earned a Golden Globe nomination in 1980 for his turn in The Ninth Configuration.  Wilson also made memorable recurring appearances on CSI as Sam Braun, the father of Marg Helgenbergerâ€™s Catherine Willows, and followed his time on The Walking Dead with roles on Bosch and The OA.  A number of Wilsonâ€™s costars shared their thoughts and memories of him following the news of his death Saturday evening.  â€œThe first time I met Scott Wilson, he gave me a big hug and said that this thing I had become apart ofâ€¦ was a family,â€ wrote TWDâ€˜s Khary Payton on Twitter. â€œHe said I had a responsibility to take care of it. I have tried very hard to do that, sir. & I will continue. I promise. See you on the other side, my friend.â€  â€œScott Wilson has departed. I am heartbroken. We are fewer. Go easy into the light brother,â€ wrote Boschâ€˜s Titus Welliver.  â€œI just heard the news about the passing of #ScottWilson,â€ Yvette Nicole Brown said on Twitter. â€œHe was a wonderful man and I am heartbroken. #RIP #Hershel #TWDâ€  â€œScott Wilson was simply the finest actor and more importantly the finest and most decent man I ever knew. A Noble actor and my dear friend,â€ wrote Rob Schneider. â€œScott Wilson had the best lady to share his life, Heavenly Wilson. My heartfelt condolences to her & to all of Scottâ€™s friends the world over.â€  See a few others below:  Rest easy my friendâ€¦â€¦ rest easy. â€” Michael Cudlitz (@Cudlitz) October 7, 2018  Goodbye Scott Wilson you absolute legend x â€” Tom Payne (@justanactor) October 7, 2018  Just learned that the wonderful actor Scott Wilson, has died. I'm terribly saddened. I just got to know Scott in the past 2-3 years, but I loved knowing him. He was a superb actor & a beloved member of our community. I'm really sorry to hear this. Rest in peace, actor. pic.twitter.com/vgsUhBxHhB â€” Jim Beaver (@jumblejim) October 7, 2018  So sorry to hear of Scott Wilson's passing.  Not only was he a sublime actor and supremely centered human being, he was a sincere advocate for actors and other industry workers.  It was an honor to know and serve with him. Carry on, brother. See you on the other sideâ€¦ https://t.co/VBUd57tgss â€” Clancy Brown (@RealClancyBrown) October 7, 2018  The official Twitter account for The Walking Dead comic book, upon which the AMC show is based, posted, â€œWe are deeply saddened to report that Scott Wilson, the incredible actor who played Hershel on #TheWalkingDead, has passed away at the age of 76,â€ the statement read. â€œOur thoughts are with his family and friends. Rest in paradise, Scott. We love you.â€

Third generation Greek immigrant John Stamos has long been a proud American, and now that heâ€™s also become a proud papa for the first time, heâ€™ll be sharing his patriotism with his new son, Billy.  Stamos, 54, will be bringing nearly 2-month-old Billy along on his first cross-country trip as the Fuller House star/producer returns to host PBSâ€™s annual broadcast of A Capitol Fourth, the national 4th of July celebration in Washington, D.C.  Get push notifications with news, features and more.  Itâ€™s been a celebratory year thus far for Stamos, who wed model/actress Caitlin McHugh in February and welcomed their new baby â€“ named after his late father â€“ in April. But the timing of the new arrival made Stamos wonder if heâ€™d be able to return to host the 38th annual 4th of July broadcast from the West Lawn of the U.S. Capitol again this year after deeply enjoying his debut stint in 2017.  John Stamosand Caitlin McHugh Rachel Murray/Getty  â€œFortunately, Iâ€™ve been able to take off work now, but I said, â€˜Well I donâ€™t know if I could do [the concert] again, because Iâ€™m having a little baby,â€™ â€ Stamos told PEOPLE at a photo shoot to promote the celebration. â€œAnd they said, â€˜Well, what can we do to get you?â€™ â€œ  The solution? Family road trip! â€œI said, â€˜Well, I got to bring the kid, then.â€™ So weâ€™re bringing Billy! And PBS just sent this really cute onesie that says â€˜Future Host,â€™ and all this patriotic stuff.â€  Itâ€™ll be baby Stamosâ€™ first cross-country excursion, coming on the heels of a slightly not-so-smooth local road trip, Stamos admitted. â€œIt was Motherâ€™s Day and Caitlinâ€™s birthday, so we went down to Laguna [Beach], and it was the first time we didnâ€™t have a nanny â€” that was rough!â€ he laughed. â€œ[But] so far, itâ€™s been a dream, and when I look at him, I feel like Iâ€™ve been thinking about that face for a long time.â€  Stamos said that fatherhood has been everything that he expected it would be, and itâ€™s deepened his connection to his country. â€œI always knew it was going to be like this,â€ he explained. â€œIt took me longer than it shouldâ€™ve, but I knew that I would be a family and be contributing to this country, and holding onto the morals and the values that my parents had, that I like to think of the world having. Itâ€™s a time to be kind and graceful to people. It just takes so much energy to block all the negativity. Iâ€™m really trying to get people together.â€  As a bonus, Stamosâ€™ longtime friends and frequent, if unofficial, bandmates â€” the iconic, multi-platinum selling music legends The Beach Boys â€” will join him in the nationâ€™s capitol as both performers and the recipients of the fifth annual A CAPITOL FOURTHâ€™s National Artistic Achievement Award, with Stamos presenting.  â€œIâ€™m just the biggest glorified fan, really,â€ Stamos said of his connection to the group, which goes back to the 1980s, appearing in their music video for â€œKokomo,â€ frequently joining them on stage behind the drum kit and executive producing the 2000 miniseries The Beach Boys: An American Family. â€œIâ€™m a fan who gets to hang out with them.â€  RELATED VIDEO: New Dad John Stamos Opens Up About Fatherhood & Reveals Which Parent His Son Looks Like  So much so that the band has become as close as family: founding member Mike Love even got ordained and officiated Stamos and McHughâ€™s wedding ceremony.  Want all the latest pregnancy and birth announcements, plus celebrity mom blogs? Click here to get those and more in the PEOPLE Babies newsletter  â€œTheyâ€™re Americaâ€™s band. Itâ€™s always a special feeling playing with them, but especially when youâ€™re in D.C. I think I said it even in the show last year: the Fourth of July, Washington, the Beach Boys â€” it doesnâ€™t get more American than that. But more than that, I love the effect they have on people and that their music has on people. In a graceless time right now, where people are looking for comfort, I think the Beach Boys music and this whole show, it does that, right?â€  An all-star roster of performers bridging a variety of American favorite musical genres will be joining Stamos and the Beach Boys for the celebration, including Jimmy Buffett and the Broadway cast of the new musical Escape From Margaritaville (this is their first stop after Broadway before launching a national tour); three-time Grammy Award-winning a capella artists Pentatonix; legendary Motown stars The Temptations; platinum country music singer-songwriter Luke Combs; country music star and American Idol alum Lauren Alaina; gospel legend CeCe Winans; and internationally-acclaimed violinist Joshua Bell; with the National Symphony Orchestra, under the direction of top pops conductor Jack Everly.  Additionally, soprano superstar RenÃ©e Fleming will perform â€œYouâ€™ll Never Walk Aloneâ€ to honor the nationâ€™s men and women in uniform and their families.  Also participating in the event will be the Choral Arts Society of Washington, the U.S. Army Herald Trumpets, the U.S. Army Ceremonial Band, Members of the Armed Forces carrying the State and Territorial Flags and the Armed Forces Color Guard provided by the Military District of Washington, D.C. The top-rated, award-winning program will be capped off with a rousing rendition of Tchaikovskyâ€™s â€œ1812 Overtureâ€ complete with live cannon fire provided by the United States Army Presidential Salute Battery, an audience favorite and â€œA Capitol Fourthâ€ tradition.  Caitlyn McHugh and son Billy John Stamos/Instagram  The celebration will culminate with the largest and most spectacular fireworks display in the nation.  â€œIt was electrifying,â€ said Stamos of his debut hosting stint. â€œAnd Iâ€™ve been in front of crowds and a lot of the shows or concerts, and Broadway stuff Iâ€™ve done. But theyâ€™re coming there for a different reason, to see something. Here I felt they were part of it. They were part of our party, part of our show. â€¦ Iâ€™ll try again this year to interact with the crowd. I let the producer and the director know, â€˜I may stop and talk to somebody,â€™ and we did it. It was really sweet.â€  Stamos was also gratified that last year during the show he was able to address the hot-button topic of immigration, a facet of American tradition he values given his own familyâ€™s history since his grandfather passed through Ellis Island to embrace the nationâ€™s traditions of liberty, opportunity and freedom of speech.  â€œThe beauty was that this country give him that, and then has given that to my father and me, and Iâ€™ll pass that on to my son, all because of an immigrant coming over,â€ said Stamos. â€œHe worked hard and took advantage, in the best sense, of what this country has to offer all of us.â€  The 38th annual broadcast of A Capitol Fourth airs on PBS Wednesday, July 4 from 8-9:30 p.m. ET before a concert audience of hundreds of thousands, millions more at home, as well as to our troops serving around the world on the American Forces Network. The program can also be heard live in stereo over NPR member stations nationwide. The concert will also be live-streamed on PBS, You Tube, Facebook and www.pbs.org/a-capitol-fourth and available as Video on Demand for a limited time only, July 4 to July 18, 2018.

The Second Amendment has continuously been under assault in the United States and in the United Nations. Most often, the attacks came from Democrats and other leftists who have long wanted to see a disarmed populace, with only the government and military maintaining access to firearms. Liberals know that an armed population will not willingly become slaves.The United Nations has long worked, on an international level, to undermine the right of individuals to keep and bear arms, particularly the right of Americans to do so. In a recent document, it sounds like representatives of the United States promised â€œfull implementationâ€ of the UNâ€™s gun-control agreement, and in doing so essentially forfeit the Second and Tenth Amendments to the United States Constitution. Perhaps most interestingly of all, the mainstream media has been entirely silent on the issueâ€¦ perhaps they donâ€™t want to laud this win and stir up patriots?The Third Review Conference for the UNâ€™s Programme of Action on Small Arms and Light Weapons concluded at the end of June. Apparently, American â€˜representativesâ€™ at the conference agreed to begin developing â€˜legal frameworksâ€™ (generally, laws and regulations) that will enforce â€œproper managementâ€ of â€œsmall arms and light weaponsâ€ stockpiles.It seems that this agreement also includes â€˜stockpilesâ€™ owned by American citizens.The United Nations, an extremely corrupt international government organization with a long track record of failure and few (if any) successes to its name, is hoping that the United States will help it to track (and likely, confiscate) firearms in the country.The conference put out a plan that included demands for a massive database of all organizations, parties, and individuals that manufacture, own, sell, trade, or transfer firearms or ammunition.This will serve as a means for the United Nations to find â€˜illicitâ€™ ammunition and firearms.Of course, given the UNâ€™s history of pushing for gun control measures, itâ€™s not beyond the pale to believe that the organization would declare wide swaths of firearms illegal, or that home manufacture of ammunition for private use or resale is illegal.If the United States passes a law, or an executive order, to compel it to cooperate with the UNâ€™s gun control objectives, that could mean that the government would actually seize such equipment on behalf of the international agency.However, it gets worse still. The â€˜Programme of Actionâ€™ also allows UN â€˜peacekeepersâ€™ to go to member nations to â€˜assistâ€™ in meeting the goals of the program.So, if the organization decides that the United States should hand over its civilian-owned AR-15s for destruction, and then decides that the process is taking too long, they could send their blue helmet and beret-wearing goons to American shores to â€˜helpâ€™ speed the process up.The conference produced a list of six points to which all member states agreed.Firstly, they all agreed to establish laws in their nations to support the effective implementation of the Programme of Action (PoA).Secondly, they agreed to strengthen â€˜coordinated approachesâ€™ nationally for implementing the PoA.Thirdly, they promised to include women in the mechanism related to said implementation.Fourth, the representatives agreed to create a â€˜national point of contactâ€™ to act in the role of liaison between nations and the UN.Fifth, they promised to â€˜make better useâ€™ of existing data to push various social and corporate policies in order to be â€˜in complianceâ€™ with UN demands concerning women, disarmament, and â€˜non-proliferation,â€™ which generally means not making new firearms for the civilian market.Finally, they agreed to â€˜significantly reduceâ€™ illicit flows of small arms through means such as â€˜voluntary surrenderâ€™ programmes and â€˜illicit weaponsâ€™ recovery.In other words, the United States government is expected to help push an absurdly anti-Second Amendment set of demands on the American people.If they donâ€™t push that set of rules upon the people swiftly enough, then the UN will decide if it wants to send armed peacekeepers to the nation or not.This agreement is wildly unconstitutional, and thatâ€™s being kind. It violates the Second Amendment, obviously, by its very nature, but it goes further than that.By requiring that state governments, county governments, and local governments bend to the wills of the federal government (and international government), it violates the Tenth Amendment, which states that powers not given to the federal government in the constitution are â€œreserved to the states respectively.â€The idea of a â€˜liaisonâ€™ between the federal government and the UN is also legally questionable.Apparently, the United Statesâ€™ representative(s) donâ€™t see a problem with this kind of unconstitutional nonsense.Perhaps itâ€™s time that Donald Trump remove the United States from the United Nations, an organization that does little more than take money from America and hands it to corrupt nations via poorly-run bureaucracies.Perhaps, before the UN lectures America and other nations for recognizing the rights of their citizens to keep and bear arms, it should look at its own failures to stop the â€˜illicit firearms trade.â€™UN Peacekeeper operations are infamous for leaving behind firearms, particularly in the third world. Thereâ€™s a reason that, among the millions of Ak-pattern rifles in Africa, there are also hundreds of thousands of G3â€™s and CETME rifles from European militaries; the UN leaves them behind when they deploy.If the UN pushes the issue, theyâ€™ll likely find that the United States is not so quick to acquiesce as third-world nations who constantly have their hands out for â€˜freeâ€™ stuff. If theyâ€™re going to attempt to undermine the laws of a nation, perhaps they should no longer operate out of the nation with legal immunity.

Of all the couples that walked the Oscars red carpet together on Sunday night, itâ€™s likely none had the same symbolic significance as Ashley Judd and Mira Sorvino. The actresses were among the earliest to come forward with their stories of being sexually harassed by Harvey Weinstein, bringing into stark relief the impact Weinstein had on their careers and on Hollywood at large. Sorvino, who won an Oscar in 1996 for the Weinstein-released Mighty Aphrodite, told The New Yorker she believed that, by turning down Weinsteinâ€™s advances, he had actively discouraged other filmmakers from working with her. Judd, who spoke to The New York Times for the first blockbuster story about Weinstein, said at the time, â€œWomen have been talking about Harvey amongst ourselves for a long time, and itâ€™s simply beyond time to have the conversation publicly.â€ (Weinstein has denied all allegations of nonconsensual sex.)  In December, Peter Jackson told New Zealandâ€™s Stuff that executives at Miramax told him about both Judd and Sorvino, â€œthey were a nightmare to work with and we should avoid them at all costs. This was probably in 1998. At the time, we had no reason to question what these guys were telling usâ€”but in hindsight, I realize that this was very likely the Miramax smear campaign in full swing. I now suspect we were fed false information about both of these talented womenâ€”and as a direct result their names were removed from our casting list.â€  Sorvino tweeted an emotional response to Jacksonâ€™s revelation:  Speaking to Vanity Fairâ€™s Krista Smith on the red carpet, Judd and Sorvino spoke about the goals of the Timeâ€˜s Up movement: â€œI want people to know that this movement isnâ€™t stopping, weâ€™re going forward until we have an equitable and safe world for women,â€œ Sorvino said:  During the ceremony, Judd will present an award alongside two other women who have accused Weinstein: Annabella Sciorra and Salma Hayek. As Rebecca Keegan reported from the Oscars rehearsals, Sciorraâ€”who claimed to The New Yorker that Weinstein raped her, and that her career suffered as a resultâ€”seemed visibly overwhelmed to be onstage.  Though the Timeâ€™s Up movement, which announced its presence forcefully with pins and an all-black dress code at the Golden Globes, announced it planned to look beyond the red carpet in its activism, Judd and Sorvinoâ€™s united presence was a reminder of how striking, and symbolic, a red carpet appearance can be. Travis Scott has pleaded guilty to disorderly conduct after being arrested during a concert in Arkansas in May 2017 on charges including inciting a riot, Us Weekly confirms.  The 25-year-old rapperâ€™s attorney Jon Nelson tells Us that his clientâ€™s case was quietly resolved in January through plea negotiations. Scott (real name Jacques Webster) pleaded guilty to the lowest charge and was required to pay $640 in court-associated costs, in addition to $6,825.31 to two people who said they were injured at the concert. The other two misdemeanor charges â€” inciting a riot and endangering the welfare of a child â€” were dismissed.  â€œObviously, [Scott] would not in any way want a riot to break out at his concert. That would not be good for him as an entertainer,â€ Nelson says. â€œTo think that he incited one is ridiculous. We think the police way overcharged him. The prosecutorâ€™s office finally did the right thing â€” they made an offer that he agreed to. â€¦ If anyone was hurt, Travis expressed concern from the beginning. He wanted to make sure those people were taken care of.â€  The attorney added that he believes the disorderly conduct charge could eventually be expunged from Scottâ€™s record.  The Rogers Police Department told Us at the time of the arrest that the â€œGoosebumpsâ€ rapper â€œencouraged people to rush the stage and bypass the security protocols to ensure concertgoer safety.â€ He was taken into custody at the Benton County Jail and released later in the evening.  The news of Scottâ€™s guilty plea comes just a few days after he became a father with girlfriend Kylie Jenner, who gave birth to the coupleâ€™s daughter, Stormi, on Thursday, February 1. A source exclusively told Us that the 20-year-old reality star is â€œloving starting a familyâ€ with Scott, whom she began dating in April 2017. Two years into a relationship with her boyfriend, actress Vanessa Kirby was shocked to wake up one day and find out she was married to Tom Cruise.  While filming â€œMission: Impossible â€“ Falloutâ€ with 56-year-old Cruise last spring, paparazzi caught the co-stars kissing on set and the tabloids went wild.  â€œEven though the [film] crew were there, it was all [in the tabloids] like, â€˜The next wife falls at his feet,'â€ Kirby, 30, told Marie Claire UK in a new interview. â€œThe most disconcerting thing was the people I didnâ€™t think would believe it, did, and they were texting my boyfriend, asking, â€˜Are you OK?â€™ I donâ€™t think they believe anything they read now because you just canâ€™t.  â€œNone of it is real,â€ Kirby added. â€œTo be getting married to him? Not even a snog, it was marriage.â€  â€œThe Crownâ€ actress has been dating actor Callum Turner for two years and plans to keep that part of her life private.  â€œIâ€™ve been lucky because I barely get recognized, and I keep my relationship super private,â€ Kirby shared. â€œ[Turner is] just completely wonderful and heâ€™s my best friend, so thatâ€™s â€¦ I guess you can either choose to talk about it or not.â€  She added, â€œIf you talk about it, it becomes interesting to people, but if you donâ€™t, then itâ€™s not.â€

Weâ€™ve got people in charge of important shit who donâ€™t believe in science, the actor said Thursday night in Los Angeles.  Harrison Ford got political on Thursday night at 3Labs in Culver City when he was honored by Conservation International, a nonprofit environmental group he has been involved with for 26 years.  "We face an unprecedented moment in this country. Today's greatest threat is not climate change, not pollution, not flood or fire," Ford said during his acceptance speech of the Founders' Award. "It's that we've got people in charge of important shit who don't believe in science."  He went on to criticize those politicians who let "political or economic self-interest denigrate or belittle sound scientific understanding of the causes and effects of human pressure on the environment."  Ford serves as executive vice chair of Conservation International, which celebrated its 30th anniversary at the event. The group aims to protect nature and specifically focused on a 'No Forests, No Future' theme at the gala, highlighting the Amazon rainforest and its importance in addressing climate change.  "I'm here tonight for one reason: I care deeply for the natural world. It's not about me, it's not about me at all, it's about this other world we're going to leave behind," the actor said. "If we don't stop the destruction of nature, nothing else will matter. Jobs won't matter, our economies won't matter, our freedoms and ethics won't matter, our children's education and potential won't matter, peace, prosperity. If we end the ability of a healthy natural world to sustain humanity nothing else will matter, simply said."  Ford has been deeply involved in the environmental cause for several decades, meeting with lawmakers, businesses and communities to discuss how to improve conservation policy and practices.  "Other than my family, doing this work has been the most important thing of my life," he said. "Nature doesn't need people, people need nature."  Music festival Rock in Rio and SC Johnson were also honored at the event, which drew Calista Flockhart, Sophia Bush and Arielle Kebbel, with a performance by Vanessa Carlton. Conservation International showed its virtual reality film Under the Canopy as well, giving guests a real-life look into the Amazon.  "If you protect tropical forests, if you end tropical forest deforestation, it would be the equivalent of basically taking every car in the planet and making it into a Tesla overnight, that's how important it is. The epicenter of that is the Amazon," said M. Sanjayan, the group's CEO and an environmental news analyst.  Conservation International launched the largest tropical forest restoration project in the world this year as a result, and Ford will have continued involvement in these worldwide environmental projects.  "We're not going to depend on governments alone, we'll help equip communities and businesses to lead," he said. "It's a long road but I have hope."

study supports clinical testing under way across u.s. early treatment with the experimental antiviral drug remdesivir significantly reduced clinical disease and damage to the lungs of rhesus macaques infected with sars cov-2 the coronavirus that causes covid-19 according to national institutes of health scientists. the study was designed to follow dosing and treatment procedures used for hospitalized covid-19 patients being administered remdesivir in a large multi center clinical trial led.

Jennifer Aniston doesn't need your consolation, advice or Brad Pitt to validate her existence  "I just want Jen to be happy *bursts into tears*"  "But she's Rachael!! She has to find love!!"  "I keep wondering when that girl will find love"  "If Jennifer Aniston can't find love, what chance do the rest of us have at happiness!"  As a journalist covering films and entertainment, these are first few thoughts I chanced upon/overheard about the world's highest paid Girl Next Door, Jennifer Aniston. News of her divorce with (now-ex) husband Justin Theroux made headlines on 16 February, and it's all anyone can talk/opine about.  As is common with news of this nature (by which I mean one that dominates pop culture), what followed next were memes about Brad Pitt and Jennifer Aniston now being single (hey, have we forgotten Angie is single too?).  Brad Pitt about to drive by Jennifer's house like...#JenniferAniston pic.twitter.com/TRNL9LQaq7 â€” Jackie (@Jackieannroth) February 15, 2018  tell jennifer aniston iâ€™m single â€” aidan (@aidan) February 16, 2018  Jennifer Aniston: single âœ”ï¸  Brad Pitt: single âœ”ï¸ pic.twitter.com/glMAiNSQXz â€” coloradainÃºtil (@soyluluuu) February 16, 2018  Somewhere, Jennifer Aniston is crafting her "Hey, let's grab coffee and catch up" text to Brad Pitt. https://t.co/pXLGo7O4Mp â€” Madeline Hill (@mad_hill) February 15, 2018  If Brad Pitt and Jennifer Aniston reunite. This will be me... pic.twitter.com/JflsgV9K9u â€” Nina Diana (@ninadonline) February 15, 2018  Brad Pitt turning up at Jennifer Aniston's place like pic.twitter.com/u4uGJ57NoO â€” Daniel (@Daniel_Reilly1) February 15, 2018  Me: *reading about Jennifer Aniston & Justin Theroux split* awww that sucks  Also me: planning Jennifer Aniston & Brad Pitt's second wedding â€” Ally Reid (@ashallann) February 16, 2018  My reaction to Jennifer Aniston separation newsğŸ˜­but realized both her and Brad Pitt are singleğŸ˜Š pic.twitter.com/RJj9UWxgxg â€” Hani Lee (@HaniLee1) February 15, 2018  Now who doesn't like a bunch of funny memes? But humour notwithstanding, there are several issues with our response to Aniston's breakup.  First of all, it's a break up. Need I remind any of you what it feels like to end ties with someone who was your partner for over five years (married for 2, together for 7)? It feels like the pits. The last thing you want to do is scroll through twitter and find your face attached to way too many memes about getting back together with a man that left you for another woman. Pretty sure Jennifer, right now, is thinking "thanks but no thanks".  We are so obssessed with happy-endings and romance that practicality, self-happiness seem to matter very little.  Has it occurred to noone that maybe, just maybe, Jennifer Aniston wants to be alone? That after a whirlwind of two marriages and much heartbreak, maybe it would better for her to be by herself? Would that be too bad? Why is it so hard for us to imagine Jennifer Aniston being alone? Or single? Does being single automatically mean someone is not happy?  Remember, the statement that those two gave out with the news of their divorce was this: "This decision was mutual and lovingly made at the end of last year. We are two best friends who have decided to part ways as a couple, but look forward to continuing our cherished friendship."  Doesn't sound any bit the heartbreak to me. If anything, Jennifer Aniston is probably happier being by herself and away from the world's baggage involving her love life. Besides, I'd like to see people trying so hard to couple up the single male actors in Hollywood.  Suggesting that Jennifer Aniston can only be happy if she's with a man, married or in a relationship is not only a perfect example of everyday sexism, it is also shortsighted.  Besides, in my humble opinion, Aniston is way beyond Brad Pitt's league. If she *had* to get together with someone in the near future, I sincerely hope it is with someone new.  Leo DiCaprio, single at 43: wow, LAD what a legend. Jennifer Aniston, single at 49: whatâ€™s wrong with her? Why canâ€™t she find love? Why canâ€™t she hang on to a man?#everydaysexism â€” Kelly Jackson (@Kelly_Jackson88) February 16, 2018  Itâ€™s so insulting to Jennifer Aniston that anyone would suggest sheâ€™ll get back with Brad Pitt now sheâ€™s single. I really hope she doesnâ€™t! â€” Serena Marchetta (@SerenaEvelyn) February 16, 2018  Updated Date: Feb 16, 2018 17:17 PM

Michael Jacksonâ€™s daughter, Paris, thanked the late music icon â€œfor the magicâ€ in an Instagram post early Tuesday morning, on what would have been the King of Popâ€™s 59th birthday.  â€œBirthday wishes to the love of my life, the one person who showed me what passion truly was, the one that gave me solid morals to live by and how to dream,â€ she wrote.  The 19-year-old, who made headlines Sunday for speaking out against â€œNazi, white supremacist jerksâ€ at the MTV Video Music Awards, shared a 2001 photo of herself kissing her dad. In it, Jackson is seen wearing his iconic white sequin glove.  â€œI will never feel love again the way I did with you,â€ her post continued. â€œYou are always with me and I am always with you. Though I am not you, and you are not me, I know with all my being that we are one. And our souls will never change in that way. Thank you for the magic, forever and always.â€  In what Rolling Stone dubbed as her â€œfirst-ever in-depth interviewâ€ following her fatherâ€™s June 2009 death, the model-actress opened up about the close-knit relationship she had with her father, saying, â€œI feel him with me all the time.â€ She was 11 years old when she spoke at his memorial service on July 7, 2009, calling him the â€œbest father you could ever imagine.â€  Jackson, who is currently filming the second season of Foxâ€™s â€œStar,â€ is the sole daughter of mother, Debbie Rowe, and father. She has two brothers, older sibling Michael Joseph Jackson Jr. and the younger Prince Michael Jackson II.

Despite all the she-said, she-said in the Taylor Swift/Katy Perry feud, Ed Sheeran said in a recent interview that he thinks the back-and-forth is overblown.  â€œI donâ€™t think she needs [to be defended] at all,â€ he told People magazine at the 2017 Songwriters Hall of Fame 48th Annual Induction and Awards Gala. â€œI donâ€™t think feud songs are a hot thing â€“ thereâ€™s always been beef songs.â€ Sheeran specifically cited Carly Simonâ€™s â€œYouâ€™re So Vainâ€ as an example of a classic â€œdiss trackâ€; Simon revealed in 2015 that she penned the 1972 hit with Warren Beatty in mind.  Earlier this year, Perry incurred the wrath of many Swift fans after the release of her hit â€œSwish Swish,â€ which many interpreted as a direct attack on the â€œWildest Dreamsâ€ singer.  â€œDonâ€™t you come for me / No, not today / Youâ€™re calculated / I got your number / â€˜Cause youâ€™re a joker / And Iâ€™m a courtside killer queen,â€ one verse partly reads.  (As though confirming that the song was indeed about Swift, Perry changed the lyrics to hold a more conciliatory tone during a live-streamed concert: â€œGod bless you on your journey, baby girl.â€ Days earlier, Perry had delivered that same line when chatting with Arianna Huffington about Swift.)  â€œI am ready to let it go,â€ she said at the time. â€œI forgive her and Iâ€™m sorry for anything I ever did, and I hope the same from here. I think itâ€™s actually like, I think itâ€™s time. There are bigger fish to fry, and there are real problems in the world. You know what Iâ€™m saying? â€¦ Thereâ€™s a lot of other things out there in the world that people need to be focused on, and I truly, like God bless her on her journey. God bless her. Honestly.â€  Earlier this month, Swift seemed to make a not-so-subtle point when she announced the release of her entire back catalog on all streaming services â€“ just as Perry dropped her fourth studio album, Witness.  Perry and Swiftâ€™s fallout dates back to 2014, when Swift suggested in a Rolling Stone interview that Perry had once stolen backup dancers out from under her, effectively throwing a wrench in their friendship.  Swiftâ€™s hit from that same year, â€œBad Blood,â€ is widely assumed to be about Perry.  As for Swift and Sheeran, their platonic friendship is rock-solid. â€œWeâ€™ve gotten matching Scottish folds, made each other arts and crafts Christmas presents, vacationed with our families, and had each otherâ€™s backs,â€ Swift told Rolling Stone earlier this year. â€œHe is the James Taylor to my Carole King and I canâ€™t imagine a time when he wouldnâ€™t be.â€

Jamie Foxx walked off an interview with ESPN after the host asked the Academy Award-winning actor about his rumored relationship with actress Katie Holmes. Speaking with Michelle Miller, the British actor admitted to opting for more independent movies after he shot to superstardom playing vampire Edward Cullen in the wildly popular Twilight series. On auditioning for entirely different roles post-Twilight, Pattinson said, â€œItâ€™s not like, â€˜Oh, Iâ€™ll come down from an ivory tower to beâ€¦â€™ I mean, these movies are hard for me to get. On breaking free from his once perceived image as a teen heartthrob, the star said, â€œI think so much of life people are trying to put you in a box and define you all the time.â€ He continued, â€œItâ€™s just exciting to have a job where youâ€™re allowed to consistently break the walls of the box around you.â€  Pattinson went on to talk about the vast amount of media attention heâ€™s received since taking on the role of a lifetime in the Twilight series, despite his best-efforts to keep his personal life under wraps. â€œIâ€™m quite an open person,â€ he said. â€œI donâ€™t want to be one of those people whoâ€™s just like, â€˜Oh, no comment,â€™ â€™cause I just think you just look like an idiot if youâ€™re in it. The Anti-Defamation League says Larry Davidâ€™s Saturday Night Live monologue â€“ in which the Curb Your Enthusiasm creator pondered his dating options in a concentration camp â€“ was â€œoffensive, insensitive & unfunny all at same time.â€  The ADLâ€™s stance, tweeted by the organizationâ€™s CEO Jonathan Greenblatt, was in line with plenty of Twitterers who started slamming the bit before the showâ€™s cast made its goodnights.  â€œHe managed to be offensive, insensitive & unfunny all at the same time Quite a feat,â€ wrote Greenblatt.  Watched #LarryDavid #SNL monologue this AM. He managed to be offensive, insensitive & unfunny all at same time. Quite a feat. â€” Jonathan Greenblatt (@JGreenblattADL) November 5, 2017  Davidâ€™s monologue â€“ watch it above â€“ started out with the comicâ€™s standard self-deprecation, joking about being a total loser during his single New York days. Then he pivoted to riskier territory â€“ Hollywoodâ€™s recent flood of sexual harassment allegations.  â€œI couldnâ€™t help but notice a very disturbing pattern emerging, which is that many of the predators are Jews,â€ said David, whose Curb Your Enthusiasm once included a plot about mistaking Survivor cast members with camp survivors, said. â€œI donâ€™t like it when Jews are in the news for notorious reasons.â€  â€œI know I consistently strive to be a good Jewish representative,â€ David said after a crude joke about Harvey Weinstein. â€œWhen people see me, I want them to say, â€˜Oh, there goes a fine Jew.â€™â€  Then he dove in head first.  â€œIâ€™ve always been obsessed with women and often wondered, if Iâ€™d grown up in Poland when Hitler came to power, and was sent to a concentration camp, would I still be checking out women in the camp? I think I would.â€  â€œHey Shlomo, look at the one by barracks 8,â€ David continued. â€œOh my God, is she gorgeous?!â€¦ Iâ€™d like to go up and say something to her.  â€œOf course, the problem is there are no good opening lines in a concentration camp: â€˜Howâ€™s it going? They treating you OK? You know, if we ever get out of here, Iâ€™d like to take you out for some latkes.â€

Shortly after Pusha used a picture of Drake in â€œblackfaceâ€ as the cover for his diss track â€œThe Story of Adidon,â€ Drake tried to explain how the controversial photo, which he dubbed â€œart,â€ came to be.  â€œThis picture is from 2007, a time in my life where I was an actor and I was working on a project that was about young black actors struggling to get roles, being stereotyped and typecast,â€ the rapper wrote in a note on social media. â€œThe photos represented how African Americans were once wrongfully portrayed in entertainment.â€  â€œThis was to highlight and raise our frustrations with not always getting a fair chance in the industry and to make a point that the struggle for black actors had not changed much,â€ he added.  But Pusha, whoâ€™s been trading jabs with Drake since last month, doesnâ€™t buy what the Canadian rapper is selling.  â€œSee, I donâ€™t know. I just know that me being a black man, thatâ€™s something Iâ€™m totally against,â€ the rapper told GQ. â€œIâ€™m just like, â€˜How could you be that comfortable, ever?â€™ Just for me, thereâ€™s no way thatâ€™s ever comfortable.â€  When reminded that Drake said it was to highlight the struggle for black actors to get roles, Pusha responded, â€œThatâ€™s not an explanation that I would accept.â€

Chris Pratt returned to Instagram for the first time since he and ex-wife Anna Faris announced their separation in August after eight years together.  The Guardians of the Galaxy star, 38, went to a screening of Thor: Ragnarok with his adorable son, Jack, and friends on Friday, November 3. The doting dad shared a sweet snap on Saturday, November 4, of himself posing with his son and a pal as they stretched out their arms and made muscles in front of a Thor poster, captioning it as â€œHOLY CRAP!! THOR RAGNAROK IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! We just laughed our asses off!!! So proud to be part of the Marvel universe.â€  HOLY CRAP!! THOR RAGNAROK IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! We just laughed our asses off!!! So proud to be part of the Marvel universe. A post shared by chris pratt (@prattprattpratt) on Nov 3, 2017 at 9:34pm PDT  An eyewitness tells Us Weekly that the Office alum snacked on a giant tub of popcorn as he watched the movie at the Arclight Hollywood with his son and a female and male friend.  The photo marked the first time Pratt posted on his formerly active social media account and his fans took notice, with many of them welcoming him back to Instagram.  As previously reported, Pratt and Faris, with whom he shares custody of their 5-year-old son, announced their separation in joint statements in August on social media, which have since been deleted. The former couple met on the set of Take Me Home Tonight in 2007 and wed in 2009.  â€œWe are sad to announce we are legally separating. We tried really hard for a long time, and weâ€™re really disappointed. Our son has two parents who love him very much and for his sake we want to keep the situation as private as possible moving forward,â€ the statements read. â€œWe still love each other and will always cherish our time together.â€  The exes remain friendly, with Pratt telling photographers that Faris â€œdid greatâ€ at the 2017 Emmy Awards in September: â€œAnna did an amazing job. She rules! She was great. Her and Allison [Janney], they both looked great.â€  Likewise, the Mom star, 40, had nothing but kind words about Pratt during an appearance on Live With Kelly and Ryan in October, where she said, â€œWeâ€™re great friends and we always will be â€¦ Life is too short.â€  Faris has most recently been linked to cinematographer Michael Barrett. Will Ferrell taken to hospital after accident  Will Ferrell taken to hospital after accident  Actor Will Ferrell was released from a hospital Friday morning after he was in a car accident the night before in Southern California, United Talent Agency confirmed in a statement to CBS News. Ferrell was not hurt, the statement said.  The driver and a colleague remain hospitalized. Another colleague was not injured.  Ferrell is "staying close by as his friends are being treated, and has expressed his deep gratitude to the first responders who were immediately at the scene and to the hospital team that took such great care of them," United Talent Agency said.  The California Highway Patrol told CBS Los Angeles that a woman in the vehicle suffered "major injuries" in the incident.  The SUV was sideswiped by another vehicle from the right rear. The SUV then lost control, hit the center divide and overturned.  The driver of the SUV and the third passenger, a man, suffered minor injuries, the highway patrol told CBS Los Angeles. The driver of the other vehicle wasn't believed to be hurt.  Video footage from the scene shows Ferrell sitting on the road and talking with a firefighter.  TMZ first reported the crash.  He was later seen talking on a cellphone as crews loaded his gurney into an ambulance.  Actor Will Ferrell talks on a cellphone as he is loaded into an ambulance after an accident on a highway in Southern California on April 12, 2018, in this image capture from video. LA-OC.tv  The highway patrol told CBS Los Angeles that the two-car accident happened on Interstate 5 just before 11 Thursday night around Aliso Viejo in Southern California.  Earlier that night, the "Anchorman" star had made an appearance as title character Ron Burgundy at a Funny Or Die event with Billy Eichner in the San Diego area to promote youth turnout in the midterm elections.

May you rest in peace my friend. You will never be forgotten.â€  Ashley Campbell, the superstarâ€™s daughter and fellow recording artist, said that she was â€œheartbroken.â€ â€œI owe him everything I am, and everything I ever will be,â€ she tweeted. â€œHe will be remembered so well and with so much love.â€  Silver Screen Collection/Hulton Archive/Getty Images  Below, EW has rounded up other messages from the industry he conquered long ago. CLOSE The 2018 Coachella lineup is here and better than ever. Time  Beyonce and Eminem are two of the headlining acts for Coachella's 2018 festival. (Photo: Getty Images)  BeyoncÃ©, The Weeknd and Eminem will headline the 2018 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival, the Goldenvoice promoters have announced â€” ending a 14-month guessing game about who would join BeyoncÃ© as the top acts at the two-weekend event April 13-15 and April 20-22 at the Empire Polo Field in Indio, Calif.  It comes as little surprise. Earlier it was reported by Consequence of Sound that Eminem and The Weeknd would be joining BeyoncÃ© for this year's festival, but requests for confirmation of the new headliners were not returned from producers.  BeyoncÃ©, who has made guest appearances at Coachella with husband Jay-Z and her sister, Solange, was supposed to headline at last year's music festival, but had to postpone after becoming pregnant with twins.  Passes go on sale at noon PT Friday at coachella.com. General admission passes are $429, including fees and taxes, while the Festival Pass and Shuttle Combo is $504. VIP Festival Passes are $999 and VIP parking is $150.  Additional general admission passes traditionally go on sale for Coachella Valley residents a few days before each show, but that hasn't been announced.  The new emphasis on hip-hop and R&B, which have supplanted rock as the most popular pop music forms, includes rappers like Tyler the Creator, Vince Staples, Migos, Post Malone and new sensation, Cardi B, who currently has her first three releases in the top 10 of the Billboard charts, becoming only the third artist to debut with three singles in the top 10 along with The Beatles and Ashanti.  Eminem, one of the biggest Grammy Award-winning rap artists of all time, returns to Coachella on a Sunday night after making a guest appearance with Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg in 2012 in the now legendary set featuring a hologram of Tupac Shakur.  Appearing on the same day as Eminem is the saxophone player who made a name for himself with Kendrick Lamar, the jazz-steeped Kamasi Washington.  Top R&B artists on the bill besides BeyoncÃ© and The Weeknd include SZA, who recently headlined Saturday Night Live, Grammy winner Miguel and Daniel Caesar, who is breaking this year out of Canada. Appearing as somewhat of a godfather of that genre is Chic, featuring the influential Nile Rodgers, which had R&B dance hits such as Everybody Dance and Le Freak in the 1970s.  Various genres of rock are represented by the return of War On Drugs, the sister group HAIM, the Brian Wilson-influenced Fleet Foxes and Portugal. the Man. All have played previous Coachellas, although Portugal. the Man finally broke into the pop upper echelons this year with its mega-hit Feel It Still.  The godfather of that genre making an appearanceis David Byrne, the leader of the new wave band the Talking Heads, who have been high on the wish list for a Coachella reunion since the festival's inception in 1999.  Electronic music also has been drawn bigger crowds at Coachella in recent years than rock and its mix with pop music well represented with Kygo, Chromeo and ODESZA.  Other noteworthy artists of that genre include Petit Biscuit, a French DJ and music producer who turned 18 less than two months ago. He is half of the indie-pop duo Mount Dreams, but released his first solo album, Presence, in 2017. He'll perform on Sunday, as will British house DJ and music producer Hannah Wants, a former professional women's soccer player.  The lineup appears to have been booked with a sensitivity to increasing female participation and ethnic diversity. An interesting booking is Los Angeles Azules, a Mexican group fusing traditional cumbia and electronic music.  The festival has become known in the industry for its leadership in fine art and cuisine, and this year will again offer the four-course Outstanding in the Field dinner in the VIP Rose Garden for $225 a person.  Coachella has dominated industry polls as the top outdoor music event since it began in 1999. It was recently named the Billboard Top Festival of the Year. It grossed a record $114 million in 2017, marking the first time a recurring festival franchise has crossed the $100 million mark at the box office. Taylor Swift's "Gorgeous" is about her new boyfriend Joe Alwyn, Swift confirmed to her fans, but a certain ex also makes a lyrical guest appearance. In the released song, the lyric is "I've got a boyfriend/He's older than us/He's in the club doing I don't know what," which led some to believe the line was about Calvin Harris (DJ, who's 33) or Tom Hiddleston (British actor, 36, the last boyfriend Swift was with before getting with Alwyn; she dated Hiddleston immediately after Harris.)  Advertisement - Continue Reading Below  But in a new behind-the-scenes, making of the song video that AT&T released today, Swift sings her original lyrics for the song. She toys with the "I've got a boyfriend" line for a bit, and, during one song-writing session, seems keen on this lyric, which leads into the "You're so gorgeous" chorus:  Iâ€™ve got a boyfriend/heâ€™s older than us/I havenâ€™t seen him in a couple of months/I go through phases when it comes to love/Iâ€™m nothing that you want, but I must say you're so gorgeous...  Watch it at the 3:00 mark:  At first glance, this could suggest the ex Swift is singing about is Harris; the two spent a lot of their relationship apart because of Swift touring for 1989 and Harris playing DJ gigs around the world. Swift went to the Met Gala, the night she and Hiddleston hit it off, alone.  But Swift dated Hiddleston right before being seen for the first time with Alwyn in October 2016. Hiddleswift first got together in June and lasted until September.  A lot of the time during their relationship, Hiddleston was in Australia shooting Thor: Ragnarokâ€”Swift even visited him over there and was spotted with the Thor cast at the moviesâ€”after they had a pretty intense start.  Hiddleston and Swift arriving in Australia together in July 2017. Getty Images  At the time of the Hiddleswift split, a source told E! that Swift "felt he wanted to take the relationship to be too public, and she was not happy about it and thought it was too much publicity." If this original "Gorgeous" lyric really is inspired by Hiddleston, it may have been that the flame the two had also burned out (perhaps Hiddleston's alleged thirst for publicity extinguished it), and Swift moved on.

The 'Scorpion' star and longtime music producer are planning to tie the knot.  Katharine McPhee and David Foster are engaged, The Hollywood Reporter can confirm.  The Scorpion actress shared an engagement ring emoji on Twitter, along with a meme of Ariana Grande posing for photographers and giving a hair flip. "And what about it?" the post reads.  According to TMZ, Foster, 68, asked for 34-year-old McPhee's hand in marriage during the couple's recent European vacation. The outlet reports that McPhee flaunted her engagement ring to family members via FaceTime on Sunday, while spending the day on the Italian island of Capri with Foster.  The pair first met on the set of American Idol when McPhee was a contestant and Foster appeared as a guest mentor in 2006. They started dating last year. Though they kept their romance under wraps for months, McPhee and Foster confirmed their relationship status when they walked the 2018 Met Gala red carpet together in May.  McPhee previously opened up about Foster's bond with her family during an interview with ET Canada.  "He actually finds a way to make my family feel more special, like, when my family's around. My sister was super-pregnant and he was taking care of her when we were at this tennis match together," she said. "He just always is so considerate of others."  McPhee was previously married to actor Nick Cokas from 2008 to 2016, while Foster was wed to model and former Real Housewives of Beverly Hills star Yolanda Hadid from 2011 to 2017. His ex-wives also include songwriter Linda Thompson, Rebecca Dyer and singer B.J. Cook.
